documents.document: Irish humans - I do not have huge # of followers but some of them do. Do keep me posted re: humanitarian aid updates. #tinythings
@EXECUTIVESTEVE Yep yep YEP. Want to see more about how we can *do* things - no matter how small. But tricksy.
@EXECUTIVESTEVE Art. 47 has been referenced in petitions to Irish govt but not directly approached... a thing to do?
@EXECUTIVESTEVE Basically 100% on the lookout for things we can do from Ireland that might a) affect US b) slam down our own dodgy policies
@EXECUTIVESTEVE dude! What can we or should we be doing, in the immediate sense? I want to know because it's ugly AF out there.
@EXECUTIVESTEVE I do wonder how many of that group are active online - some must be. But don't know stats re: age etc.
@EXECUTIVESTEVE I'm not part of that 'we' so can't really speak to it - I've always been a cranky liberal bitch tbh. :)
This super-homophobic organisation is okay if....oh god this is so missing the point. https://t.co/iOXZMa5sFk
The need* for YA books like @acthomasbooks's The Hate U Give increases by the hour. *yes sometimes problematic term, let's discuss later k?
The word 'fucked' comes to mind. https://t.co/eS5PPsotp3
'Misogyny in liberal circles: a memoir'. *weeps*
@corinneduyvis YESSS, it's whether you put 'most affected' vs 'most privileged' at center. It's all clicking now. :)
@corinneduyvis @findmereading that was actually exactly what I was thinking of! But way of organising circle different in my head. Cool. x
But hey. Anyone following #repealthe8th coverage would be aware of this gap. If they really cared. Hmm.
1) not comparable 2) people grow 3) those of us lamenting did not support this at the time.
But the notion that those of us lamenting Trump's crazy racism are hypocritical because our country passed a dodgy resolution 13 yrs ago...
So am not 100% sure of this 'cause I was exam-ing etc but I do not think I voted re: citizenship 2004? (Was 18 that yr.) If so, am v sorry.
@corinneduyvis (am thinking circles here, so v sorry if there's a scheme of framing this stuff I'm not familiar with!)
@corinneduyvis I might be an idiot here but from other tweets 'support out, venting in' seems more like what you're talking about?
@mrsmanlapas It is a world of horrible. Yep.
@IrishLitTimes oh dear.
@mrsmanlapas Travelling to the US is still *such* a thing for the rest of the world that it'll never quite be comparable, though.
@mrsmanlapas noooooooooooo! I think cultural influence will make that impossible - world is invested in making this okay.
@mrsmanlapas OOOH I do like how you think with the moneyz. :)
@mrsmanlapas our govt leader is going over to lick Trump's boots on St Patrick's Day. It will be painful for all.
@mrsmanlapas ah, we're really not - on a handful of rights issues *maybe*, but we're too tied to US economic interests. RAAAARG.
@mrsmanlapas Am also so conscious of our complicity in #Muslimban - Irish airports host US security pre-clearance. We're working on it.
@mrsmanlapas Oh, we're a disaster for pregnant women. But doing OK for some other vulnerable groups, which is a relief. But still. Raarg.
So basically the 8th amendment is bad, you guys.... #obviousstatementofobviousness
@mrsmanlapas *looks at Ireland* OH GOD. This is not a great 'lesser of two evils'.
@IrishLitTimes thanking you! Feeling properly 'down with the kids' if that is a phrase still in use these days.
But what happens when they keep the pregnancy? Ann Lovett. Is a distinct possibility. Because the shame & lack of support still there. So.
Like, abortions in YA (& most fiction/media!) are still super-rare. Irish teenager travelling to UK for one? Fetch the smelling salts....
Mind you, I am still glad that it's in my work. That the new book - even though it is a novel - has so very much of this anger fuelling it.
@kevinpmoriarty whisht, I've a flippin' book out soon, can I not have a breather? :P
I've written a lot about this in the past while but it hasn't exorcised anything, really.
Moments like Savita, Ann Lovett... they're visceral. It could be you. It could so easily be you. You realise how vulnerable your body is.
Kitty Holland's Savita book has been on my shelf for book-research for past 2 yrs & oh, just, oh. It's too horrible.
I care a lot about the US but also I'm still dealing with how my own country lets pregnant women die so there's a lot of stuff going on.
@june_yards parody & also it's a bit like 'beam me up Scotty'. SPEAKING OF WHICH.
@june_yards how DARE they. NOT EVEN IN THE ACTUAL BOOKS. *frowns*
@klally6 I ask the hard questions... ;)
@june_yards d'you mean within a series or just the further-away-in-time world? 'Cause damn she doesn't do continuity super-well....
@june_yards more of that soon yes yes.
@ickle_tayto I'm failing as a human and as a Claire, tbh.
@ickle_tayto This is a very good question.
@ickle_tayto I'm there the previous Sat! High-fives on getting Saturday dates, yo!
@june_yards ALSO SO GLAD YOUR TWEETS ARE LOCKED. #classyhuman
@june_yards though Dahl's work as a whole is infinitely stronger. But then again he didn't write ten bajillion* books. *okay, 700ish
@june_yards Dahl is most delightful! Do adore. I'm just such a sucker for Blyton's school stories.
@ickle_tayto May 2018! If the world is still here by then, obvs... are you June?
@tiemystring I'm a terrible woman altogether.
@euphrosyna Indeed. Picked mostly because they are two key 'classic' kidlit writers that are still v popular with modern kids.
@theghoststation I had Patrick Stewart vs Ian McKellen yesterday. I'm a MONSTER.
@june_yards And 'abnormal' implies 'wrong, freakish' etc. SO judgey.
@june_yards and also plenty of straight people do things with that too, like. Within 'normal' range, def.
